definition: to struggle to get free/to strive to acquire/to make (money)
to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)

sentences.english: It is a gift, a gift to the 22)throes of Mordor.
sentences.chinese: 這魔戒是送給垂死掙扎的魔朵的禮物。

sentences.english: The enemy became more frantic in its death-bed struggle.
sentences.chinese: 敵人更加瘋狂地進行垂死掙扎。

sentences.english: The banks are now desperately scrabbling to recover their costs.
sentences.chinese: 爲了彌補損失，銀行現在只能垂死掙扎了。

sentences.english: The enemys dead bed struggles only accelerate their death.
sentences.chinese: 敵人的垂死掙扎只能加速他們的滅亡。

sentences.english: It is the statue of the "Dying Gaul".
sentences.chinese: 這是一尊“垂死掙扎的高盧人”的雕塑。
比如存在着忍飢挨餓的孩子或者垂死掙扎的母親。

sentences.english: Then dying, after that crash at 80 miles an hour.
sentences.chinese: 然後她垂死掙扎，在時速80邁的撞車之後。

definition: without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to walk right into the trap
to submit to the will of heaven/to resign oneself to fate/to trust to luck
to have no sense of shame/brazen
sugar-coated bullets, term used by Mao (originally in 1949) to refer to corrupting bourgeois influences
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
